(on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]) | clubnumber = 24 | youthyears1 = {{0|0000}}–2010 |youthclubs1 = Hard Foundation | youthyears2 = 2010–2012 |youthclubs2 = [[Standard Liege]] | years1 = 2012– |clubs1 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] |caps1 = 0 |goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2012–2013 |clubs2 = → [[ADO Den Haag]] (loan) |caps2 = 36 |goals2 = 2 | years3 = 2014–2015 |clubs3 = → [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] (loan) |caps3 = 33 |goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2015–2016 |clubs4 = → [[Kasımpaşa S.K.|Kasımpaşa]] (loan) |caps4 = 25 |goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2016–2017 |clubs5 = → [[Alanyaspor]] (loan) |caps5 = 26 |goals5 = 1 | years6 = 2017–2018 |clubs6 = → [[Kasımpaşa S.K.|Kasımpaşa]] (loan) |caps6 = 28 |goals6 = 1 | years7 = 2018– |clubs7 = → [[CD Leganés|Leganés]] (loan) |caps7 = 16 |goals7 = 0 | pcupdate = 14:52, 11 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalyears1 = 2009 | nationalteam1 = [[Nigeria national under-17 football team|Nigeria U17]] | nationalcaps1 = 7 | nationalgoals1 = 1 | nationalyears2 = 2011 | nationalteam2 = [[Nigeria national under-20 football team|Nigeria U20]] | nationalcaps2 = 5 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2013– | nationalteam3 = [[Nigeria national football team|Nigeria]] | nationalcaps3 = 43 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | ntupdate = 14:39, 18 December 2018 (UTC) }} '''Kenneth Josiah Omeruo''' (born 17 October 1993) is a Nigerian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)|defender]] for [[Club Deportivo Leganés|CD Leganés]] on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] and the [[Nigerian national football team|Nigeria national team]].{{cite web|author=Eredivisie |url=http://eredivisielive.nl/eredivisie/speler/857253/kenneth-omeruo/ |title=Kenneth Omeruo, ADO Den Haag |publisher=Eredivisielive.nl |date= |accessdate=31 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120514112702/http://eredivisielive.nl/eredivisie/speler/857253/kenneth-omeruo/ |archivedate=14 May 2012 |df= }}{{cite web|url=http://www.worldfootball.net/spieler_profil/kenneth-omeruo/ |title=Kenneth Omeruo |publisher=Worldfootball.net |date=17 October 1993 |accessdate=31 May 2012}} Omeruo signed for Chelsea from [[Standard Liege]] in January 2012 and upon signing went on loan to Dutch top-flight side [[ADO Den Haag]]. Then only 19, he impressed enough in the [[Eredivisie]] to earn a call up to the Nigerian national team. Now a regular international, Omeruo has represented Nigeria at the [[2013 Africa Cup of Nations]] and the [[2013 Confederations Cup]] in Brazil. Omeruo cemented a place in the starting line-up at the Africa Cup of Nations as it turned into a wonderful tournament for the Super Eagles and they emerged from the tournament victorious.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25204040|title=Is Nigeria's Kenneth Omeruo Chelsea's best kept secret?|date=4 December 2013|accessdate=6 January 2014|publisher=BBC Sport}} ==Club career== ===Early career=== Omeruo had spells at [[Sunshine Stars F.C.|Sunshine Stars]] and [[Anderlecht (football club)|Anderlecht]] as a trialist before he was signed from the Anderlecht academy by [[Standard Liège]].{{cite web|url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/talentspotter-meet-kenneth-omeruo-best-chelsea-player-youve-never-heard?|title=Meet Kenneth Omeruo, the best Chelsea player you've never heard of|date=6 January 2014|accessdate=6 January 2014|publisher=FourFourTwo}} ===Chelsea=== In January 2012, Chelsea signed Omeruo from Liège and immediately loaned him out to [[Eredivisie]] club [[ADO Den Haag]].{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story/_/id/1005272/chelsea-linked-with-move-for-standard-defender-kenneth-omeruo?cc=5901 |title=Chelsea linked with move for Standard defender Kenneth Omeruo |publisher=ESPN Soccernet |date=7 January 2012 |accessdate=31 May 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-india/news/222/transfer-zone/2012/01/08/2836305/chelsea-sign-nigerian-youngster-kenneth-omeruo |title=Chelsea Sign Nigerian Youngster Kenneth Omeruo |publisher=Goal.com |date=8 January 2012 |accessdate=8 January 2012}} In May 2014 Nigeria World Cup-bound Omeruo agreed a new three-year contract with [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]].{{cite web|url=http://africanfootball.com/news/430249/Omeruo-agrees-new-Chelsea-contract|title=OMERUO AGREES NEW CHELSEA CONTRACT|publisher=africanfootball.com |date=26 May 2014 |accessdate=28 May 2014}} On 31 August 2016, Omeruo signed a one-year contract extension until 2019, before leaving on loan again.{{cite web|url=https://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2016/08/new-contract-and-loan-for-omeruo.html |title=New contract and loan for Omeruo |date=31 August 2016 |publisher=Chelsea F.C.}} ====Loan to ADO Den Haag==== Omeruo joined [[ADO Den Haag]] on an 18-month loan deal which kept him at the club until the end of the 2012–13 season.{{cite news|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11661/7416126/Chelsea-linked-to-Omeruo |title=Chelsea linked to Omeruo |publisher=Sky Sports |date=7 January 2012 |accessdate=7 January 2012}} On 3 March 2012, Omeruo made his debut for ADO Den Haag against [[SC Heerenveen]] which ended in a 0–0 draw.{{citation|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2012/03/03/netherlands/eredivisie/hfc-ado-den-haag/sportclub-heerenveen/1120519/ |title=ADO Den Haag vs. Heerenveen 0 - 0|publisher=Soccerway |date=3 March 2012|accessdate=31 May 2012}} On 19 April 2012, in a game against [[FC Groningen]] Omeruo scored his first goal for ADO Den Haag.{{cite news|author=Barry Glendenning |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2012/may/09/football-the-knowledge |title=The Knowledge | English football's only joint own goal|publisher=Guardian |date= 9 May 2012|accessdate=31 May 2012 |location=London}} On 28 April 2012, Omeruo scored against [[VVV-Venlo]] in the 19th minute, although just three minutes later scored an own goal.{{citation|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2012/04/28/netherlands/eredivisie/vvv-venlo/hfc-ado-den-haag/1120594/ |title=VVV-Venlo v.s. ADO Den Haag 2-1|publisher=Soccerway |date=28 April 2012|accessdate=31 May 2012}} He is the only player in the Dutch league ever to score a goal, an own goal and receive a red card in one match. ====Loan to Middlesbrough==== On 7 January 2014, Omeruo joined [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] on loan until the end of the [[2013–14 in English football|2013–14]] season.{{Cite web|title=Boro Seal Omeruo Loan |url=http://www.mfc.co.uk/page/news/latest/0,,1~3607917,00.html |work=Middlesbrough FC |date=7 January 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140515143919/http://www.mfc.co.uk/page/news/latest/0%2C%2C1~3607917%2C00.html |archivedate=15 May 2014 |df= }} On 1 February 2014, Omeruo made his debut for Middlesbrough in a 0–0 draw against [[Doncaster Rovers F.C.|Doncaster Rovers]].{{Cite web |title=Doncaster Rovers vs. Middlesbrough 0 - 0 |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2014/02/01/england/championship/doncaster-rovers-fc/middlesbrough-football-club/1484373/ |work=Soccerway |date=1 February 2014}} On 8 April 2014, Omeruo was sent off in the 82nd minute after picking up a second yellow. Although Boro had to finish the game with 9-men ([[Ben Gibson (footballer)|Ben Gibson]] was also sent off late in the game), they still managed to earn a 3–1 win victory against [[Birmingham City]].{{Cite web |title=Middlesbrough v.s. Birmingham 3 - 1 |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2014/04/08/england/championship/middlesbrough-football-club/birmingham-city-fc/1484516/ |work=Soccerway |date=8 April 2014}} He rejoined Middlesbrough for the [[2014–15 in English football|2014–15]] season,{{Cite web |title=Middlesbrough complete Kenneth Omeruo loan deal from Chelsea |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28662451 |work=BBC Sport |date=6 August 2014}} making his first appearance against [[Birmingham City|Birmingham]] in a 2-0 win. ====Loan to Kasımpaşa==== On 21 July 2015, Omeruo joined [[Kasımpaşa Spor Kulübü|Kasımpaşa]] on a season-long loan with an option to purchase the player at the end of the spell.{{Cite news |title=Omeruo Kasımpaşamızda |url=http://www.kasimpasaspor.org.tr/haberler/haber/1010555-omeruo-kasimpasamizda |publisher=Kasımpaşa |date=21 July 2015}} On 16 August 2015, Omeruo made his debut for Kasımpaşa in a match against [[Gaziantepspor]], the match ended in a 3–0 victory for Kasımpaşa.{{Cite news |title=Gaziantepspor vs. Kasımpaşa 0 - 3 |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/08/16/turkey/super-lig/gaziantepspor/kasimpasa-sk/2074329/ |publisher=Soccerway |date=16 August 2015}} Five days later, Omeruo made his home debut against [[İstanbul Başakşehir F.K.]] which ended in a 1–0 victory for Kasımpaşa.{{Cite news |title=Kasımpaşa vs. İstanbul Başakşehir 1 - 0 |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/08/21/turkey/super-lig/kasimpasa-sk/istanbul-buyuksehir-bsk/2074340/ |publisher=Soccerway |date=21 August 2015}} Omeruo had an up and down season, suffering from a couple injuries, however started whenever he was fit. Although the loan deal had an option to buy, Kasımpaşa decided to pass on the option due to a lack of funds, which led to Omeruo returning to Chelsea for pre-season.{{Cite news |title=Kenneth Omeruo To Return To Chelsea For Pre-Season Training |url=http://www.allnigeriasoccer.com/read_news.php?nid=19196/ |publisher=AllNigeriaSoccer |date=27 May 2016}} ====Loan to Alanyaspor==== On 31 August 2016, after he served out for Kasımpaşa, Omeruo joined [[Alanyaspor]] on a season-long loan. He was given the number 44. On 10 September 2016, Omeruo made his debut in a 0–0 draw against [[Gençlerbirliği S.K.|Gençlerbirliği]].{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2016/09/10/turkey/super-lig/genclerbirligi/alanyaspor/2291169/ |title=Gençlerbirliği vs. Alanyaspor 0 - 0 |date=10 September 2016 |publisher=Soccerway }} On 25 February 2017, Omeruo scored his first goal for Alanyaspor in their 4–1 home victory over [[Adanaspor]], netting in the hosts' second in the 37th minute.{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2017/02/25/turkey/super-lig/alanyaspor/adanaspor-fk/2291338/ |title=Alanyaspor vs. Adanaspor |date=25 February 2017 |publisher=Soccerway }} ====Return to Kasımpaşa==== On 25 August 2017, preceding signing a new three-year deal at Chelsea, Omeruo returned to [[Kasımpaşa S.K.|Kasımpaşa]] on a season-long loan.{{Cite news |title=New contract and loan for Omeruo |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2017/08/new-contract-and-loan-for-omeruo.html |publisher=Chelsea Official Site |date=25 August 2017 |accessdate=25 August 2017}} ====Loan to CD Leganés==== On 15 August 2018, Omeruo joined [[Club Deportivo Leganés|CD Leganés]] on a season-long loan.{{Cite news |title=Leganes Loan For Omeruo |url=https://www.chelseafc.com/en/news/2018/8/15/leganes-loan-for-omeruo.html |publisher=Chelsea Official Site |date=15 August 2018 |accessdate=15 August 2018}} In October 2018 he stated that he was enjoying playing in Spain.https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45939555 ==International career== [[File:Argentina-Nigeria (3).jpg|thumb|Omeruo with Nigeria against Argentina in a friendly match in 2017]] Omeruo played for the Nigerian Under-20 team that reached the quarter-finals at the [[2011 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] in [[Colombia]].{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/89/africa/2012/03/02/2942516/under-20-nigeria-international-kenneth-omeruo-set-for-dutch |title=U-20 Nigeria international, Kenneth Omeruo set for Dutch debut.|publisher=Goal.com |date=2 March 2012 |accessdate=31 May 2012}} On 9 January 2013, at the age of 19 he played for the senior team for the first time in a goalless draw against [[Cape Verde national football team|Cape Verde]]. He then went on to play in all of Nigeria's matches at the [[2013 Africa Cup of Nations]] as Nigeria went on to win the competition for the third time.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20970786|title=Nations Cup 2013: Nigeria pick six locally-based players|author=Oluwashina Okeleji|date=10 January 2013|accessdate=10 January 2013|publisher=BBC Sport}} Later that year he was selected for Nigeria's squad at the [[2013 FIFA Confederations Cup]] and played in all of the three group games as Nigeria finished third in their group.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22827902|title=Nigeria to take new-look squad to Confederations Cup|date=9 June 2013|accessdate=10 June 2013|publisher=BBC Sport}} Omeuro was named in Nigeria's final squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] and started in all four games as Nigeria finished second in their group and were eliminated by France at the Round of 16.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/27969976 |title=France scored twice in the final 11 minutes in Brasilia to beat Nigeria and reach the World Cup quarter-finals. |work=BBC Sport |date=30 June 2014 |accessdate=22 October 2014 }} He was selected by Nigeria for their 35-man provisional squad for the 2016 Summer Olympics,{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36623763|title=Kelechi Iheanacho included in Nigeria's Olympics squad|date=24 June 2016|accessdate=25 June 2016|author=Oluwashina Okeleji|publisher=BBC Sport}} but did not make the final 18- man squad.{{cite web|url=http://punchng.com/mikel-makes-olympics-squad-awoniyi-standby/|title=Mikel makes Olympics squad, Awoniyi on standby|date=24 July 2016|accessdate=24 July 2016|publisher=Punch}} In May 2018 he was named in Nigeria's preliminary 30 man [[Nigeria national football team|squad]] for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia.{{Cite news|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/amp/news/revealed-every-world-cup-2018-squad-23-man-preliminary-lists/oa0atsduflsv1nsf6oqk576rb|title=Revealed: Every World Cup 2018 squad - 23-man & preliminary lists & when will they be announced? {{!}} Goal.com|access-date=1 June 2018|language=en}} ==Playing style== Omeruo has been described as a "tall, rangy but strong centre-back" and a "level-headed and determined youngster". ==Personal life== His younger brother Lucky Omeruo is also a footballer, who currently plays for Pembroke Athleta F.C. as a striker{{cite web|url=http://www.completesportsnigeria.com/news/2014/05/omeruo-anyanwu-boost-rangers |title=Lucky Omeruo, younger brother of Chelsea of England and Super Eagles defender, Kenneth Omeruo |date=4 December 2013 |accessdate=6 January 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140512225501/http://www.completesportsnigeria.com/news/2014/05/omeruo-anyanwu-boost-rangers |archivedate=12 May 2014 |df= }} and for the [[Nigeria national under-20 football team]].{{cite web|url=http://www.mtnfootball.com/africa/nigeria/premier-league/news/2013/jul/17-foreign-players-pay-stops-omeruo.html|title= Foreign player's pay stops Omeruo - MTNFootball|date=14 July 2013|accessdate=14 July 2013|publisher=MTN}} Omeruo and his wife, Chioma Omeruo, have welcomed their first child, a girl named [http://mercyobidakemedia.com/super-eagles-defender-kenneth-omeruo-and-wife-chioma-welcome-their-first-child/ Chairein Omeruo] . ==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|10 February 2019}}[https://int.soccerway.com/players/kenneth-omeruo/102548/ Soccerway profile] {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !colspan="2"|Club Performance !colspan="2"|League !colspan="2"|Cup !colspan="2"|League Cup !colspan="2"|Continental !colspan="2"|Total |- !|Club !|Season !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals |- !colspan="2"|Netherlands 173 !! 4 |} ===International=== :''Statistics accurate as of match played 26 June 2018.''{{NFT player|50699|Kenneth Omeruo|accessdate=23 June 2018}} {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center"
